# DEPARTMENT OF STATE TELEGRAM
**UNCLASSIFIED**

1. EMBASSY HAS RECEIVED LETTER FROM MINISTER OF DEFENSE,
JAIME MENDIETA VARGAS, WITH REFERENCE TO SUCH CREDIT. INFORMAL
TRANSLATION FOLLOWS:
"I HAVE THE PLEASURE TO RESPOND TO YOUR LETTER OF APRIL 17
IN WHICH YOU HAD THE KINDNESS TO INFORM OF THE ALLOCATION TO
BOLIVIA OF $4 MILLION IN FOREIGN MILITARY SALES CREDIT AT AN
ANNUAL INTEREST RATE OF 7-1/8 PERCENT OVER AN 8-YEAR TERM
WITHOUT A GRACE PERIOD.
   I THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR KINDNESS IN INFORMING
ME OF THE ABOVE, AND HAVING CONSULTED WITH HIS EXCELLENCY,
THE PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC, I SHOULD INFORM YOU THAT THE
MINISTRY, UNDER MY COMMAND, ACCEPTS WITH PLEASURE THE REFERENCED
CREDIT AND IN DUE COURSE WILL INFORM YOU CONCERNING THE MATERIAL
TO BE IMPORTED."


2. THE EMBASSY IS POUCHING THE ORIGINAL OF THIS LETTER TO ARA/BC/B.








 252115Z


3. COMMENT: U.S. MILGP REPORTS THAT MINISTRY OF DEFENSE SENT




                      

                 

TELEX TODAY TO AMBASSADOR VALENCIA INSTRUCTING HIM TO DO WHATEVER
IS NECESSARY TO ACCEPT THE $4 MILLION CREDIT.
STEDMAN
